Does evolution disprove God at all? No. Evolution may perhaps be God's way of creating. Adam and Eve could very well have existed and been the direct results of God's system of evolution rather than two beings that God beamed down from heaven. Their is nothing to indicate that, just because man may be a descendant of ape, he was NOT created in God's image. After all, apes are just another one of God's creations. Some argue that God created man directly, others' argue that God created the earth which gave birth to man. Either way, evolution does not suggest that there is no God or that it disproves the bible. 
 
 I've done three important things in this arguement: I make the suggestion that God could exist, I offer another form of evidence, biblical translation, to those who disagree with scientific fact, and I still lobby evolution without harming anyone's beliefs. It is a win-win situation for both parties regarding this topic.
 
 2.)Compromise is another powerful tool. I also used compromise above because I am an atheist, so it really means something when I suggest that God could exist and evolution is his form of creation. I sacrificed something of my belief in the hopes that someone else would sacrifice their beliefs to give evolution fair thought. But let's look at abortion. I am pro-life. Not because I care so much about a fetus, but because I think abortion is ignorant and breeds ignorance. However, in France, they have an abortion pill, called RU-486, they have been using it for over 10 years with a 95% success rate. Our food and drug administration won't let it in, even though it is far safer than traditional suction operations, which are often left incomplete. I believe that if abortion was made illegal, then this pill would be able to make it to the U.S. and we could be rid of the traditional method which is very dangerous and ignorant.
 
 I compromise here, I ask for your support to illegalize traditional abortion so that this newer and safer form can be adopted here.
 
 3.)Devil's advocate. This is the most fun. I use it often. You play both sides of an arguement or perhaps realize both sides of an arguement can't win. Typically, when one side of the arguement gets an advantage, you rally for the otherside. Both parties will either hate you or appreciate your support and be apt to listening to you. If you play Devil's advocate, you should respect the position and really have some unique ideas on the topics you are rallying and be a great benefit to the arguement, rather than an annoyance. It's a coin toss, you have to know who you are dealing with when you play 'advocate'.
 
 4.)Make friends with your enemies. They will be more apt to respect you and listen to you seriously if you have common ground in other subjects. And besides, even Canadian's have something to offer. ;)
 
 There are other formats, there is a debate format that I think is called the Rogerian format. You might want to read up on it, but it is basically a format that tries to get your audiences approval. It is partially based on finding common ground, compromising, and being respectful to your audience while slowly converting them to your side. Anyway, hope that helped.  Your terms micro truth and macro truth, while interesting have nothing to do with truth. The definition of truth is whether or not a statement lines up with reality. If I say there is no gas in my tank and there is indeed no gas in my tank then I have spoken the truth. If there is gas in my tank, I have spoken falsely. This is the nature of reality.
 
 It is why I say your statement is a logical fallacy. While it certainly has humor I would argue it has no wisdom. 
 
 The micro truths you speak of are observations. They are not devoid of interpretation as we all know that there are different shades of blue and one may say navy blue and the other say "no just dark blue, not navy." Observations by their nature are not truth but statements of what is observed by the observer's perceptions. Truth is whether or not what is said lines up with reality. To say the car is red for example is only true if the car bounces wavelengths of light of the order of 630 nanometers. 
 
 The macro truth you talk about is not a truth but an opinion based upon observation. A theory per se. This is not truth. The word truth has a definition. 
 
 The universal truth, there are some that exist. All things are relative is not one of them. It is not a well established fact. There are some absolutes. The idea that there are not absolutes is ridiculous given that the statement "there are no absolutes" is in and of itself an absolute. The logical fallacy of a statement like all things are relative is obvious if one will but look. There must be absolutes. If there aren't then we would all go spinning off the globe into outer space at an enourmous velocity. There would not likely even be a predictable trajectory. 
 
 I'll give you one absolute that is absolutely absolute rather than all of this abstract concept. Death. You will die. So will I. There is no stopping it. 
 
 Check your thinking. Once you begin to accept the absolutes of the world, life actually gets easier.
